verses.verse: Canst thou draw out <S%H4900><s%> leviathan <S%H3882><s%> with a hook? <S%H2443><s%> or his tongue <S%H3956><s%> with a cord <S%H2256><s%> which thou lettest down? <S%H8257><s%>
Canst thou put <S%H7760><s%> a hook <S%H100><s%> into his nose? <S%H639><s%> or bore <S%H5344><s%> his jaw <S%H3895><s%> through with a thorn? <S%H2336><s%>
Will he make many <S%H7235><s%> supplications <S%H8469><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> thee? will he speak <S%H1696><s%> soft <S%H7390><s%> words unto <S%H413><s%> thee?
Will he make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> thee? wilt thou take <S%H3947><s%> him for a servant <S%H5650><s%> forever? <S%H5769><s%>
Wilt thou play <S%H7832><s%> with him as with a bird? <S%H6833><s%> or wilt thou bind <S%H7194><s%> him for thy maidens? <S%H5291><s%>
Shall the companions <S%H2271><s%> make a banquet <S%H3738><s%> of <S%H5921><s%> him? shall they part <S%H2673><s%> him among <S%H996><s%> the merchants? <S%H3669><s%>
Canst thou fill <S%H4390><s%> his skin <S%H5785><s%> with barbed irons? <S%H7905><s%> or his head <S%H7218><s%> with fish <S%H1709><s%> spears? <S%H6767><s%>
Lay <S%H7760><s%> thine hand <S%H3709><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> him, remember <S%H2142><s%> the battle, <S%H4421><s%> do no <S%H408><s%> more. <S%H3254><s%>
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> the hope <S%H8431><s%> of him is in vain: <S%H3576><s%> shall not one be cast down <S%H2904><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> at <S%H413><s%> the sight <S%H4758><s%> of him?
None <S%H3808><s%> is so fierce <S%H393><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> dare stir him up: <S%H5782><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> then is able to stand <S%H3320><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me?
Who <S%H4310><s%> hath prevented <S%H6923><s%> me, that I should repay <S%H7999><s%> him? whatsoever is under <S%H8478><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> heaven <S%H8064><s%> is mine.
I will not <S%H3808><s%> conceal <S%H2790><s%> his parts, <S%H905><s%> nor <S%H1697><s%> his power, <S%H1369><s%> nor his comely <S%H2433><s%> proportion. <S%H6187><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> can discover <S%H1540><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of his garment? <S%H3830><s%> or who <S%H4310><s%> can come <S%H935><s%> to him with his double <S%H3718><s%> bridle? <S%H7448><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> can open <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of his face? <S%H6440><s%> his teeth <S%H8127><s%> are terrible <S%H367><s%> round about. <S%H5439><s%>
His scales <S%H650><s%> <S%H4043><s%> are his pride, <S%H1346><s%> shut up together <S%H5462><s%> as with a close <S%H6862><s%> seal. <S%H2368><s%>
One <S%H259><s%> is so near <S%H5066><s%> to another, <S%H259><s%> that no <S%H3808><s%> air <S%H7307><s%> can come <S%H935><s%> between <S%H996><s%> them.
They are joined <S%H1692><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another, <S%H251><s%> they stick together, <S%H3920><s%> that they cannot <S%H3808><s%> be sundered. <S%H6504><s%>
By his sneezes <S%H5846><s%> a light <S%H216><s%> doth shine, <S%H1984><s%> and his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are like the eyelids <S%H6079><s%> of the morning. <S%H7837><s%>
Out of his mouth <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6310><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> burning lamps, <S%H3940><s%> and sparks <S%H3590><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%> leap out. <S%H4422><s%>
Out of his nostrils <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5156><s%> goeth <S%H3318><s%> smoke, <S%H6227><s%> as out of a seething <S%H5301><s%> pot <S%H1731><s%> or caldron. <S%H100><s%>
His breath <S%H5315><s%> kindleth <S%H3857><s%> coals, <S%H1513><s%> and a flame <S%H3851><s%> goeth out <S%H3318><s%> of his mouth. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6310><s%>
In his neck <S%H6677><s%> remaineth <S%H3885><s%> strength, <S%H5797><s%> and sorrow <S%H1670><s%> is turned into joy <S%H1750><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him.
The flakes <S%H4651><s%> of his flesh <S%H1320><s%> are joined together: <S%H1692><s%> they are firm <S%H3332><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> themselves; they cannot <S%H1077><s%> be moved. <S%H4131><s%>
His heart <S%H3820><s%> is as firm <S%H3332><s%> as <S%H3644><s%> a stone; <S%H68><s%> yea, as hard <S%H3332><s%> as a piece <S%H6400><s%> of the nether <S%H8482><s%> millstone.
When he raiseth up <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7613><s%> himself, the mighty <S%H410><s%> are afraid: <S%H1481><s%> by reason of breakings <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7667><s%> they purify themselves. <S%H2398><s%>
The sword <S%H2719><s%> of him that layeth <S%H5381><s%> at him cannot <S%H1097><s%> hold: <S%H6965><s%> the spear, <S%H2595><s%> the dart, <S%H4551><s%> nor the habergeon. <S%H8302><s%>
He esteemeth <S%H2803><s%> iron <S%H1270><s%> as straw, <S%H8401><s%> and brass <S%H5154><s%> as rotten <S%H7539><s%> wood. <S%H6086><s%>
The arrow <S%H1121><s%> <S%H7198><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> make him flee: <S%H1272><s%> slingstones <S%H68><s%> <S%H7050><s%> are turned <S%H2015><s%> with him into stubble. <S%H7179><s%>
Darts <S%H8455><s%> are counted <S%H2803><s%> as stubble: <S%H7179><s%> he laugheth <S%H7832><s%> at the shaking <S%H7494><s%> of a spear. <S%H3591><s%>
Sharp <S%H2303><s%> stones <S%H2789><s%> are under <S%H8478><s%> him: he spreadeth <S%H7502><s%> sharp pointed things <S%H2742><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the mire. <S%H2916><s%>
He maketh the deep <S%H4688><s%> to boil <S%H7570><s%> like a pot: <S%H5518><s%> he maketh <S%H7760><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> like a pot of ointment. <S%H4841><s%>
He maketh a path <S%H5410><s%> to shine <S%H215><s%> after <S%H310><s%> him; one would think <S%H2803><s%> the deep <S%H8415><s%> to be hoary. <S%H7872><s%>
Upon <S%H5921><s%> earth <S%H6083><s%> there is not <S%H369><s%> his like, <S%H4915><s%> who is made <S%H6213><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> fear. <S%H2844><s%>

He beholdeth <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> high <S%H1364><s%> things: he <S%H1931><s%> is a king <S%H4428><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of pride. <S%H7830><s%>
